channel.title: Problem when running
channel.description:
[img]http://gyazo.com/0b48f1c3169833b74a941b1cb172fce8.png[/img]
someone tell me whats wrong?
[code=abap]@echo off @title iFlareSoft java -Xms512m -Xmx1024m -cp bin;lib/jython.jar;lib/slf4j-api-1.5.8.jar;lib/mina-core-2.0.0-M6.jar;lib/slf4j-jdk14-1.5.8.jar;lib/commons-compress-1.0.jar;lib/junit-4.6.jar;lib/mysql.jar;lib/xpp.jar;lib/xstream.jar org.rs2server.Server pause exit[/code]

item.title: Problem when running
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[quote=“cocoa, post:2, topic:382996”]In the error message it says “Address already in use: bind”

While I’m not extremely familiar with BindExceptions I would assume that means you’ve got something running on the same port as your server is trying to run on or you’ve already got the server running and are trying to run it again on the same port.[/quote]
I’ll second that.

I’ve noticed something recently, lots of people having already open ports but realising there’s not another batch file or program running…

… and a lot of people getting hacked…

… and a lot of noobs posting downloads with RuneScape password grabbing code.

Could the code be opening a port and secretly sending information to the hacker. Could happen.

Random scenario I thought I’d put out there.

EDIT: Nvm then.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem when running
item.dc:creator: @youdunce2 youdunce2
item.description:
@youdunce2 wrote:

[quote=“cocoa, post:2, topic:382996”]In the error message it says “Address already in use: bind”

While I’m not extremely familiar with BindExceptions I would assume that means you’ve got something running on the same port as your server is trying to run on or you’ve already got the server running and are trying to run it again on the same port.[/quote]

lol thanks, i failed i forgot to turn off my other server

@cocoa wrote:

In the error message it says “Address already in use: bind”

While I’m not extremely familiar with BindExceptions I would assume that means you’ve got something running on the same port as your server is trying to run on or you’ve already got the server running and are trying to run it again on the same port.
